title: (x) Bank of England banknote reverse - similar to Colonna, various suggestions {Andreas H, Seb}
content:
My first thought was that this is custom lettering but are there any similar typefaces? In particular the K.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bankofengland 2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021143834/http:/typophile.com/files/bankofengland%202_0.jpg) | 171.27 KB |
author: nickplant

comments.content:
Some similar ones:

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/diploma/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021143834/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/diploma/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/diploma/")  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/viva/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021143834/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/viva/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/viva/")

Also, do a search for 'inline', 'tooled' or 'engraving'
Colonna MT is closer and has the additional advantage of already being present on any HD with MS Office.
